metadata.title: CVE-2023-31085 on Ubuntu 22.04 FIPS Undergoing Certification (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/mtd/ubi/cdev.c in the Linux kernel 6.2.There is a divide-by-zero error in do_div(sz,mtd->erasesize), usedindirectly by ctrl_cdev_ioctl, when mtd->erasesize is 0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-31085` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-89-generic - 5.15.0-89.99
linux-image-5.15.0-89-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-89.99
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-89-generic - 5.15.0-89.99
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-89-generic-64k - 5.15.0-89.99
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1047-kvm - 5.15.0-1047.52
No subscription required
